elements.name: Name dem Aufgaben
elements.title: Answer the following questions about the newspaper article "Eggs for Christmas cookies missing - prices massively higher" (Blick, 30.11.2022).

elements.name: question1
elements.title: What was the situation on the Swiss egg market just before Christmas 2022?
elements.correctAnswer: Swiss eggs became scarce and the import quotas were used up.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: What are import quotas?
elements.correctAnswer: Import quotas are imposed by the state. They specify the quantity of a product that may be imported into Switzerland from abroad each year.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: To which influencing factor can the import quotas be attributed?
elements.correctAnswer: This is a state intervention (external influencing factor).

elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Answer the following questions about the newspaper article "Eggs for Christmas cookies missing - prices massively higher" (Blick, 30.11.2022).

elements.name: question3
elements.title: What other influencing factor plays a key role in the egg shortage shortly before Christmas?
elements.correctAnswer: Customer behavior. The demand for eggs is high.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: What effect does the egg shortage have on the price?

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: Answer the following questions about the newspaper article "Eggs for Christmas cookies missing - prices massively higher" (Blick, 30.11.2022).

elements.name: question6
elements.title: How is Migros responding to the egg shortage?
elements.correctAnswer: Migros puts Swiss eggs on the shelves that deviate from the norm and would not be sold under normal circumstances.

elements.name: question7
elements.title: What are the causes of the egg shortage?
elements.correctAnswer: Many chickens had to be killed due to bird flu. In addition, many farmers have reduced or completely stopped production due to increased costs.
